citation.article-title: Psychrobacter submarinus sp. nov. and Psychrobacter marincola sp. nov., psychrophilic halophiles from marine environments.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Psychrobacter submarinus sp. nov.
Psychrobacter submarinus (sub.ma.ri'nus. L. prep. sub under; L. adj. marinus of the sea; N.L. adj. submarinus from under the sea)
Aerobic, Gram-negative, non-motile, non-pigmented, non-spore-forming, ovoid cells, 1.6-1.9 μm long and 0.7-1.0 μm in diameter.
Oxidase-and catalase-positive.
Colonies on nutrient agar are whitish, circular with an entire margin, convex, 2-3 mm in diameter.
No fluorescent pigments are formed.
Moderately halophilic.
Sea water is required for growth; growth occurs in the presence of 0.5-15.5% (w/v) NaCl.
Psychrophilic.
Temperature range for growth is 4-35°C, with an optimum at 25-28°C.
Does not grow at 37 or 40°C.
pH range for growth is 5.5-9.5, with optimum growth at 6.5-8.5.
Strain is negative for Simmons' citrate test, ONPG test, acetoin production, H2S production and denitrification.
Other physiological reactions are listed in Table 1.
Susceptible to ampicillin (10 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), carbenicillin (25 μg), polymyxin (300 U), streptomycin (30 μg) and neomycin (15 μg).
Resistant to benzylpenicillin (10 U), lincomycin (15 μg), oleandomycin (15 μg) and tetracycline (30 μg).
The major fatty acid is C18:1ω7c.
The phospholipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylserine.
The G+C content of the DNA is 46.7 mol% (determined by the thermal denaturation method).
Strain KMM 225T (=DSM 14161T) is the type strain, isolated from sea water at 300 m deep in the Pacific Ocean.
